text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Morimoto was born in Osaka Prefecture on January 6, 1974. She played for Prima Ham FC Kunoichi. In 1992 season, she was selected Young Player Awards. In December 1993, Morimoto was selected the Japan national team for 1993 AFC Championship. At this competition, on December 6, she debuted against Philippines. She also played at 1997 AFC Championship. She played 10 games and scored 2 goals for Japan until 1998. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1993 2 0 1994 1 0 1995 0 0 1996 0 0 1997 5 2 1998 2 0 Total 10 2 ==References== Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Osaka Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Iga FC Kunoichi Mie players Category:1993 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1997 AFC Women's Championship players
title: Yuko Morimoto
